Title: 404 Not Found
Cause: Resource or endpoint does not exist
How to Fix: Verify URL paths and ensure endpoint exists
Example After: Use the correct endpoint in API requests
Notes: Common in HTTP-based services during development or migration.

Title: 500 Internal Server Error
Cause: Server misconfiguration or runtime issues
How to Fix: Inspect server logs and fix code issues
Example Before: Failing server due to unhandled errors
Example After: Add error-handling mechanisms on the server
Notes: Generic error indicating problems in server-side processing or configuration.

Title: AmbiguousMappingError
Cause: Overlapping or conflicting mappings in REST controllers
How to Fix: Define unique request mappings in controllers
Example Before: Two @GetMapping annotations for the same path
Example After: Define unique paths for each @GetMapping
Notes: Happens when endpoints conflict in Spring Boot REST controllers.

Title: AnnotationConfigurationConflictError
Cause: Conflicting annotations that affect bean behavior
How to Fix: Use consistent and non-conflicting annotations
Example After: Separate transactional and caching logic
Notes: Leads to runtime conflicts in bean execution behavior.

Title: AnnotationFormatError
Cause: Invalid annotation types detected during runtime.
How to Fix: Verify annotations and ensure their proper usage.
Example After: Use only valid and well-defined annotations.
Notes: Common in annotation-based processing frameworks.

Title: ArithmeticException
Cause: Dividing by zero or invalid mathematical operations
How to Fix: Add checks to prevent invalid operations
Example After: if (denominator != 0) int result = 1 / denominator;
Notes: Common during division operations where denominator is zero.

Title: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Cause: Accessing array elements outside defined bounds.
How to Fix: Validate indices before accessing arrays.
Example After: if(index >= 0 && index < arr.length) value = arr[index];
Notes: Raised in dynamic array data manipulation.

Title: ArrayStoreException
Cause: Attempting to store an incompatible type in an array.
How to Fix: Ensure the type of objects being stored matches the array's declared type.
Example Before: Object[] objArray = new String[5]; objArray[0] = new Integer(10);
Example After: Use arrays with compatible types.
Notes: Occurs in array manipulations with polymorphism.

Title: AssertionError
Cause: Assertion conditions fail during runtime.
How to Fix: Ensure logical conditions in assertions are valid and meaningful.
Example After: Correct logic or disable assertions if not needed.
Notes: Raised during testing/debugging phases.

Title: AttributeError
Cause: Attempting to access an undefined object attribute
How to Fix: Check attribute existence with hasattr()
Example After: if hasattr(object, 'defined_attr'): print(object.defined_attr)
Notes: Raised when invalid attributes are referenced on objects.

Title: AuthenticationException
Cause: Errors during user authentication in secure systems.
How to Fix: Validate credentials and ensure correct authorization workflows.
Example After: Use proper credentials and authentication services.
Notes: Occurs in enterprise-level secure applications.

Title: BatchUpdateException
Cause: Batch operations failed due to invalid data or queries.
How to Fix: Debug and ensure all batch queries are valid.
Example After: Validate batch queries before execution.
Notes: Common in bulk database updates.

Title: BeanCreationException
Cause: Misconfigured beans in application context
How to Fix: Review bean configuration
Example After: Add a correct bean definition using @Bean
Notes: Happens when Spring fails to instantiate a required bean.

Title: BeanCurrentlyInCreationException
Cause: Circular bean dependencies during initialization
How to Fix: Refactor beans or use @Lazy annotation
Example Before: Circular dependency between BeanA and BeanB
Example After: Use @Lazy or restructure bean dependencies
Notes: Happens when beans reference each other during initialization.

Title: BeanInitializationException
Cause: Incorrect bean configuration or dependencies
How to Fix: Review bean properties and dependencies
Example After: Properly configure beans with @Bean or @Configuration
Notes: Occurs due to improper dependency injection setup.

Title: BootstrapMethodError
Cause: Invalid method references during class bootstrapping.
How to Fix: Validate and debug bootstrap method configurations.
Example After: Ensure valid bootstrap configurations and libraries.
Notes: Occurs in advanced JVM internals.

Title: BufferOverflowError
Cause: Writing beyond the allocated memory of a buffer
How to Fix: Validate data size before writing into buffers
Example Before: Writing 20 bytes into a buffer of size 10
Example After: Ensure buffer size is sufficient for data
Notes: Common in low-level languages like C or C++.

Title: BufferUnderflowException
Cause: Attempting to read from a buffer that has no remaining elements.
How to Fix: Ensure sufficient elements exist in the buffer before reading.
Example After: if(buffer.hasRemaining()) buffer.get();
Notes: Occurs during memory read operations.

Title: CacheLoaderException
Cause: Failure while loading cache values.
How to Fix: Ensure cache loader logic is properly configured and tested.
Example After: Validate inputs and ensure cache keys are correct.
Notes: Raised during dynamic cache loading operations.

Title: CertificateEncodingException
Cause: Errors encoding X.509 certificates.
How to Fix: Verify and use valid certificate data.
Example After: Ensure encoding parameters align with specifications.
Notes: Raised in cryptographic validations.

Title: CertificateExpiredException
Cause: X.509 certificate has expired.
How to Fix: Replace expired certificates with valid ones.
Example After: Use renewed certificates to ensure validity.
Notes: Occurs in secure server-client communications.

Title: CertificateRevokedException
Cause: Certificate revoked due to compromise or expiry.
How to Fix: Use valid and non-revoked certificates.
Example After: Validate certificate revocation list (CRL) before usage.
Notes: Raised in secure environments needing compliance.

Title: ChangeDetectionError
Cause: Angular's change detection fails during updates
How to Fix: Avoid circular updates or complex bindings
Example Before: Updating the same bound variable in multiple places
Example After: Refactor bindings to prevent circular updates
Notes: Happens frequently during dynamic UI updates.

Title: CircularDependencyError
Cause: Dependencies referencing each other cyclically
How to Fix: Refactor dependencies to remove circular references
Example After: Use @Lazy annotation or refactor modules
Notes: Common in Angular and Spring Boot when services depend on each other directly.

Title: ClassCastException
Cause: Incorrect type casting that is incompatible.
How to Fix: Check object compatibility using instanceof.
Example After: if(obj instanceof String) String str = (String) obj;
Notes: Occurs frequently in collections or object casting.

Title: ClassCircularityError
Cause: Circular dependencies detected during class loading.
How to Fix: Refactor classes to eliminate circular dependencies.
Example Before: ClassA refers to ClassB, which refers back to ClassA.
Example After: Restructure dependencies to avoid circular references.
Notes: Occurs during complex class loading scenarios.

Title: ClassFormatError
Cause: Invalid bytecode format during class loading.
How to Fix: Recompile the class or validate its bytecode.
Example After: Use properly compiled and valid class files.
Notes: Common in applications with dynamic loading of compiled classes.

Title: ClassNotFoundException
Cause: Class definition not found at runtime.
How to Fix: Include all necessary classes in runtime classpath.
Example After: try { Class.forName("ValidClass"); } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {}
Notes: Common in dynamic loading scenarios.

Title: CloneNotSupportedException
Cause: Attempting to clone an object that does not support cloning.
How to Fix: Implement Cloneable interface and define clone() method.
Example After: try { obj.clone(); } catch (CloneNotSupportedException e) {}
Notes: Occurs during deep/shallow copy operations.

Title: CMMException
Cause: Errors with color profile in Color Management Module.
How to Fix: Validate and debug color profile inputs.
Example After: Use standard-compliant color profiles.
Notes: Common in image rendering and printing applications.

Title: CodeCacheOverflowError
Cause: JVM code cache exceeded its allocated size.
How to Fix: Increase code cache size using JVM flags.
Example Before: Dynamic method calls in JIT compiler.
Example After: Use JVM options like -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize to adjust limits.
Notes: Rarely occurs in highly dynamic applications.

Title: CompletionException
Cause: Errors during asynchronous task completion.
How to Fix: Debug underlying tasks for exceptions or invalid states.
Example After: Handle completion results gracefully with appropriate error handling.
Notes: Occurs in CompletableFuture workflows.

Title: ComponentFactoryResolverError
Cause: Failing to resolve dynamic components
How to Fix: Import component modules and ensure correct configurations
Example After: Declare dynamic components in entryComponents
Notes: Happens when dynamically loading components in Angular apps.

Title: ConcurrencyError
Cause: Conflicts during simultaneous access to shared resources
How to Fix: Use synchronization mechanisms
Example Before: Multiple threads modifying the same variable
Example After: Use locks, semaphores, or thread-safe methods
Notes: Occurs in multi-threaded or parallel programming environments.

Title: ConcurrentModificationException
Cause: Modifying a collection while iterating over it.
How to Fix: Use fail-safe collections like CopyOnWriteArrayList.
Example After: List safeList = new CopyOnWriteArrayList(list); safeList.add(newElement);
Notes: Raised in collections with concurrent modifications.

Title: ConnectException
Cause: Failure to establish a connection.
How to Fix: Ensure server availability; validate connection.
Example After: try { socket.connect(); } catch (ConnectException e) {}
Notes: Raised during client-server communication.

Title: ConstraintViolationError
Cause: Violating table constraints such as NOT NULL, UNIQUE
How to Fix: Validate input data before insertion
Example Before: Inserting duplicate values in a unique column
Example After: Ensure data integrity with validations
Notes: Occurs due to lack of proper database input validation.

Title: ConstraintViolationException
Cause: Violating constraints defined on request parameters
How to Fix: Ensure request matches validation constraints
Example After: Send valid request: age = 18
Notes: Common with bean validation annotations like @Min, @Max, or @NotNull.

Title: ContentProjectionError
Cause: Incorrect or missing ng-content projection
How to Fix: Ensure correct usage of Angular content projection
Example After: Add proper <ng-content> or resolve projection issues
Notes: Common in Angular when projecting content improperly within components.

Title: CORS Policy Error
Cause: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions
How to Fix: Configure backend to allow specific domains
Example After: Update server settings to include valid headers
Notes: Often faced in web application development while integrating APIs.

Title: CursorNotFoundException
Cause: Cursor used in database operations is invalid or closed.
How to Fix: Ensure cursor state before performing operations.
Example After: Validate cursor lifecycle and close state.
Notes: Common when working with large datasets in databases.

Title: DataFormatException
Cause: Invalid format for compressed data operations.
How to Fix: Ensure that the data matches the expected compression format.
Example After: Validate compressed data before attempting inflation.
Notes: Raised during data decompression.

Title: DatagramSocketException
Cause: Errors during DatagramSocket operations.
How to Fix: Ensure proper socket configurations and availability.
Example After: Validate socket and packet configurations before sending.
Notes: Raised in UDP-based applications.

Title: DataIntegrityViolationException
Cause: Violating database constraints such as NOT NULL
How to Fix: Handle exceptions and validate input before saving
Example Before: Saving NULL in a NOT NULL column
Example After: Perform validation or set default values
Notes: Often caused by mismatched entity constraints and database schema.

Title: DataMismatchException
Cause: Data type mismatch during query execution
How to Fix: Ensure data types match between schema and query
Example After: SELECT * FROM table WHERE id = 1;
Notes: Occurs during operations where data types do not align.

Title: DataTruncation
Cause: Data was truncated during transmission or storage.
How to Fix: Adjust database field sizes or validate inputs.
Example After: Ensure field constraints align with data size.
Notes: Common in database operations with fixed-size fields.

Title: DataTypeMismatchError
Cause: Mismatched data types between columns and query values
How to Fix: Use correct data types for columns in queries
Example After: SELECT * FROM table WHERE age = 25;
Notes: Occurs when incompatible types are used in WHERE or JOIN conditions.

Title: Deadlock Error
Cause: Two processes waiting on each other for resources
How to Fix: Use proper transaction isolation levels
Example Before: Multiple processes locking the same rows
Example After: Use WITH(NOLOCK) or restructure queries
Notes: Common in concurrent transactions with poor locking mechanisms.

Title: DependencyNotFoundError
Cause: Dependency not registered in applicationContext
How to Fix: Verify bean registration and import statements
Example After: Define the missing bean in configuration class
Notes: Happens when required beans are not defined in the application context.

Title: DivisionByZeroError
Cause: Attempting to divide a number by zero
How to Fix: Add checks to prevent division by zero
Example After: if (denominator != 0) result = 10 / denominator;
Notes: Occurs in arithmetic operations in all programming languages.

Title: DuplicatedAnnotationError
Cause: Using duplicate annotations on the same element
How to Fix: Remove redundant annotations
Example After: Use a single @NotNull annotation
Notes: Leads to unnecessary validations and possible conflicts.

Title: EmptyStackException
Cause: Attempting to access or modify elements of an empty stack.
How to Fix: Ensure stack size is non-empty before operations.
Example After: if(!stack.isEmpty()) stack.pop();
Notes: Frequently occurs in stack-based data structures.

Title: EntityNotFoundException
Cause: Attempting to retrieve a nonexistent entity
How to Fix: Ensure the entity exists or handle exceptions
Example After: Use Optional.isPresent() or .orElse() to handle
Notes: Happens when querying non-existent records in the database.

Title: EnumConstantNotPresentException
Cause: Accessing an undefined constant in an enum type.
How to Fix: Use valid enum constants in the application.
Example After: Validate enum constant names and values before accessing.
Notes: Common in enum-based logic flows.

Title: EOFException
Cause: Unexpected end of input stream during data reading.
How to Fix: Ensure input streams are complete; handle EOF.
Example After: try { stream.read(); } catch (EOFException e) {}
Notes: Raised in file and stream operations.

Title: ExemptionMechanismException
Cause: Errors using an exemption mechanism for cryptographic operations.
How to Fix: Validate exemption policies and mechanisms.
Example After: Use correct exemption parameters and keys.
Notes: Raised when cryptographic policies are misconfigured.

Title: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError
Cause: Changing bound properties during the change detection cycle
How to Fix: Avoid modifying properties inside lifecycle hooks like ngAfterViewInit
Example After: Modify data outside of Angular lifecycle hooks
Notes: Happens when Angular's change detection flow gets interrupted.

Title: ExpressionChangedError
Cause: Modifying bound properties during lifecycle hooks
How to Fix: Avoid property mutations within Angular hooks
Example After: Update model outside lifecycle hooks
Notes: Common during dynamic UI manipulations in Angular.

Title: FactoryBeanInjectionError
Cause: Improper injection of beans created via FactoryBean
How to Fix: Use @Autowired on the factory bean directly
Example Before: Injecting the actual bean instead of the factory
Example After: Inject the FactoryBean instead
Notes: Happens when dependencies created using Factory Beans are improperly injected.

Title: FactoryConfigurationError
Cause: Issues with factory configuration during framework startup.
How to Fix: Debug factory class and ensure proper configurations.
Example After: Use valid factory settings or initialize defaults.
Notes: Common in XML, database, and library frameworks.

Title: FileNotFoundError
Cause: Specified file does not exist
How to Fix: Verify file paths or handle exceptions
Example After: try: open('file') except: handle block
Notes: Always validate the file's existence before trying to access it.

Title: FileNotFoundException
Cause: Missing file at the specified path.
How to Fix: Verify file paths and existence before access.
Example After: try { FileReader file = new FileReader("x"); } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {}
Notes: Common cause during file operations.

Title: ForeignKeyViolationError
Cause: Inserting data that violates foreign key constraints
How to Fix: Ensure related records exist before insertion
Example Before: Adding a record with a non-existent foreign key value
Example After: Insert valid foreign key referencing the parent table
Notes: Happens in relational databases when referencing non-existent keys.

Title: HeapOverflowError
Cause: Exceeding the heap memory limit
How to Fix: Optimize memory usage and avoid unnecessary object creation
Example After: Use object pooling or dispose unused objects
Notes: Occurs when memory allocation exceeds available heap size.

Title: HttpMediaTypeNotAcceptableException
Cause: Media type mismatch during response creation
How to Fix: Set appropriate Accept header in requests
Example Before: Requesting text/html when response is in application/json
Example After: Request response in compatible type using Accept: application/json
Notes: Happens when client expectations and server responses are mismatched.

Title: HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException
Cause: Unsupported media type in request
How to Fix: Specify correct Content-Type header in the request
Example Before: Sending Content-Type: text/plain to an endpoint requiring JSON
Example After: Send Content-Type: application/json
Notes: Common when API endpoints accept specific media types, e.g., application/json.

Title: HttpMessageConversionException
Cause: Mismatched content in the request/response body
How to Fix: Correct data structure and use appropriate @RequestBody
Example Before: Sending invalid JSON to a REST controller
Example After: Send valid JSON matching the expected structure
Notes: Happens during serialization/deserialization of mismatched data formats.

Title: HttpMessageNotReadableException
Cause: Mismatch in JSON structure during request parsing
How to Fix: Ensure proper JSON format in requests
Example After: Send proper JSON: {"id": 1}
Notes: Occurs due to incorrect serialization/deserialization.

Title: HttpRequestMethodNotSupportedException
Cause: Using unsupported HTTP methods
How to Fix: Verify allowed methods on the endpoint
Example Before: Sending POST to a GET-only endpoint
Example After: Use GET when the endpoint allows only GET
Notes: Occurs due to mismatched HTTP methods (e.g., GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).

Title: HttpStatusCodeException
Cause: Returning incorrect HTTP status codes
How to Fix: Set proper status codes in the ResponseEntity
Example After: Use ResponseEntity.status(HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST) for failure
Notes: Happens when status codes don’t reflect actual API outcomes (e.g., 200 for errors).

Title: IllegalAccessException
Cause: Trying to access a class, method, or field without proper permissions.
How to Fix: Ensure correct access modifiers and use AccessibleObject.setAccessible(true) if needed.
Example After: try { f.setAccessible(true); } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {}
Notes: Occurs when using reflection to access private or protected members.

Title: IllegalAnnotationCombinationError
Cause: Using mutually exclusive annotations together
How to Fix: Use compatible annotation combinations
Example After: Use @Transactional or remove @Modifying
Notes: Occurs when annotations conflict in database transaction configuration.

Title: IllegalArgumentException
Cause: Passing illegal or inappropriate arguments to a method.
How to Fix: Validate inputs before method invocation.
Example After: if(time >= 0) Thread.sleep(time);
Notes: Common when validating method arguments.

Title: IllegalBlockSizeException
Cause: Attempting to encrypt or decrypt data with an incorrect block size.
How to Fix: Ensure the input data matches the expected block size for the cipher.
Example After: Use padding or modify input data to match the block size.
Notes: Raised in encryption/decryption operations.

Title: IllegalChannelGroupException
Cause: Invalid grouping of network channels in I/O operations.
How to Fix: Ensure channel groups are compatible and valid.
Example After: Verify compatibility between grouped channels.
Notes: Common in asynchronous networking operations.

Title: IllegalComponentStateException
Cause: Invoking methods on GUI components in an invalid state.
How to Fix: Validate component state before performing operations.
Example After: Ensure buttons are properly initialized before manipulation.
Notes: Common in GUI applications with improper UI manipulation.

Title: IllegalFormatException
Cause: Invalid format specifiers or arguments in formatting strings.
How to Fix: Validate arguments and format specifiers.
Example After: Use correct arguments to match format specifiers.
Notes: Common in string formatting issues.

Title: IllegalMonitorStateException
Cause: Calling wait() or notify() outside a synchronized block
How to Fix: Synchronize blocks before calling thread methods
Example After: Wrap obj.wait() in synchronized block
Notes: Happens in multithreaded applications when monitor methods are improperly used.

Title: IllegalPathStateException
Cause: Providing an illegal path during a graphic operation.
How to Fix: Verify path validity and use supported parameters.
Example After: Ensure path coordinates are valid and fall within constraints.
Notes: Raised in graphical rendering or manipulation.

Title: IllegalStateException
Cause: Invoking methods in an inappropriate state or condition.
How to Fix: Ensure the object’s state is valid for the operation.
Example After: Validate object states and use methods in appropriate conditions.
Notes: Raised due to incorrect usage of state-sensitive methods.

Title: IllegalThreadStateException
Cause: Thread state does not allow the requested operation.
How to Fix: Ensure proper thread lifecycle handling before invoking operations.
Example After: Avoid invoking start() on already-started threads.
Notes: Raised during thread execution errors.

Title: IncompatibleClassChangeError
Cause: Attempting to perform incompatible changes to a class.
How to Fix: Refactor incompatible changes and ensure compatibility across versions.
Example After: Align changes with JVM compatibility standards.
Notes: Raised during incompatible modifications.

Title: IndentationError
Cause: Misaligned code or inconsistent indentation
How to Fix: Properly align code blocks, avoid mixing tabs
Example After: Properly indenting with consistent spaces
Notes: Strict indentation rules in Python often cause this error.

Title: IndexError
Cause: Accessing an invalid index in a list or tuple
How to Fix: Validate index range before accessing
Example Before: my_list[10] when my_list has only 5 elements
Example After: if index < len(my_list): print(my_list[index])
Notes: Commonly occurs during loop operations with lists.

Title: InjectorCircularDependency
Cause: Services/modules referencing each other in a loop
How to Fix: Refactor to remove circular dependencies
Example After: Use @Optional() or restructure modules
Notes: Angular fails to resolve dependency injection in circular cases.

Title: InjectorError
Cause: Failing to inject dependencies due to incorrect configurations
How to Fix: Verify dependency injection and provided services
Example After: Add dependency in providers in Angular
Notes: Common error in Angular apps while resolving dependencies at runtime.

Title: InputMismatchException
Cause: Incorrect input format during parsing operations.
How to Fix: Validate input format before parsing data.
Example Before: scanner.nextInt(); // entered text instead of number
Example After: if(scanner.hasNextInt()) int number = scanner.nextInt();
Notes: Raised in scanner and input processing.

Title: InstantiationError
Cause: Instantiating abstract classes directly
How to Fix: Use concrete subclasses or proper constructors
Example After: ConcreteClass obj = new ConcreteClass();
Notes: Common mistake when working with abstract class hierarchies in Java.

Title: InstantiationException
Cause: Attempting to instantiate abstract classes or interfaces.
How to Fix: Refactor code to use concrete implementations.
Example After: Properly implement the abstract classes.
Notes: Raised in runtime object creation.

Title: InterruptedException
Cause: Thread interrupted during waiting or sleeping.
How to Fix: Handle interrupts using try-catch blocks.
Example After: try { Thread.sleep(1000); } catch (InterruptedException e) {}
Notes: Commonly occurs in multithreaded applications.

Title: InterruptedIOException
Cause: Input/output operation was interrupted, such as timeout.
How to Fix: Handle timeouts and retries in the operations.
Example After: try { inputStream.read(); } catch (InterruptedIOException e) {}
Notes: Occurs during network-based file or stream operations.

Title: InvalidAnnotationPlacement
Cause: Placing annotations at incorrect locations
How to Fix: Verify placement of annotations
Example After: Use @Transactional at method or class level
Notes: Happens when annotations are used in unsupported contexts.

Title: InvalidBeanDefinitionError
Cause: Bean defined incorrectly or missing in the context
How to Fix: Ensure proper bean definitions
Example Before: Defining @Bean without a method return type
Example After: Define a proper bean method with a return type
Notes: Happens during Spring Boot application startup if the bean configuration is incorrect.

Title: InvalidClassException
Cause: Mismatch between the serialized class and the loaded class during deserialization.
How to Fix: Ensure both serialized and deserialized classes are compatible.
Example After: Ensure serialization IDs are consistent.
Notes: Common when deserializing objects across different class versions.

Title: InvalidDefinitionException
Cause: Misconfigured or incomplete serialization setup
How to Fix: Use correct annotations such as @JsonIgnore
Example Before: Attempting to serialize a circular reference
Example After: Annotate fields with @JsonIgnore
Notes: Common during JSON serialization of bidirectional relationships in entities.

Title: InvalidDnSyntaxException
Cause: Invalid syntax detected in distinguished names (DN).
How to Fix: Correct DN syntax and ensure compliance with LDAP standards.
Example After: Validate DN syntax before passing into search queries.
Notes: Frequently occurs during enterprise directory services.

Title: InvalidFormatException
Cause: Improper field formatting during JSON deserialization
How to Fix: Ensure correct format of fields in JSON
Notes: Happens when incorrect field formats mismatch with deserialization expectations.

Title: InvalidKeyException
Cause: Using an invalid key for cryptographic operations.
How to Fix: Validate key formats and ensure compatibility with cryptographic algorithms.
Example After: Use valid key formats and types compatible with algorithms.
Notes: Occurs during encryption or decryption operations.

Title: InvalidMarkException
Cause: Attempting to reset a buffer to an invalid mark position.
How to Fix: Use the mark() method only when a valid mark exists.
Example After: if(buffer.marked()) buffer.reset();
Notes: Common in NIO (New I/O) buffer operations.

Title: InvalidPathException
Cause: Indicates an invalid syntax or format in file paths.
How to Fix: Validate file paths before accessing or manipulating files.
Example After: Correct file path syntax before usage.
Notes: Raised during file or directory operations.

Title: InvalidPreferencesFormatException
Cause: Preferences data is improperly formatted or corrupted.
How to Fix: Ensure the preferences file has the correct format before loading.
Example After: Use valid preferences XML files when importing data.
Notes: Occurs during preferences file import/export operations.

Title: InvalidScopeAnnotationError
Cause: Using invalid or unsupported scope annotations
How to Fix: Use valid scope annotations such as @Singleton
Example After: Use valid scope annotation like @Scope("prototype")
Notes: Common when defining custom bean scopes incorrectly.

Title: InvalidTypeError
Cause: Using a value of one type where another is expected
How to Fix: Validate data types before operations
Example After: Use String value = 1 + Integer.toString(abc);
Notes: Common during operations involving mismatched types.

Title: InvocationTargetException
Cause: Exception raised by a method invoked using reflection.
How to Fix: Inspect the underlying cause with getCause() and handle it accordingly.
Example After: try { m.invoke(obj); } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {}
Notes: Common when invoking methods dynamically via reflection.

Title: IOException
Cause: Issues with file or input/output streams.
How to Fix: Handle with try-catch; validate file paths.
Example After: try { FileReader file = new FileReader("x"); } catch (IOException e) {}
Notes: Occurs during file operations and stream handling.

Title: JarException
Cause: Errors encountered while reading or writing JAR files.
How to Fix: Validate JAR files before processing.
Example After: Ensure the JAR file is complete and valid.
Notes: Frequently raised when dealing with archives.

Title: JsonMappingException
Cause: Issues with mapping JSON to Java objects
How to Fix: Ensure correct JSON structure or field names
Example Before: JSON field names do not match POJO field names
Example After: Use @JsonProperty or correct field names in the JSON
Notes: Common during JSON deserialization in REST APIs.

Title: KeyError
Cause: Accessing nonexistent keys in a dictionary
How to Fix: Use .get() or validate key existence
Example After: my_dict.get('missing_key', default_value)
Notes: Common during dictionary operations in Python.

Title: KeyViolationError
Cause: Inserting duplicate keys into a unique column
How to Fix: Ensure unique values or handle exceptions
Example After: Avoid duplicates or use ON CONFLICT handling
Notes: Common in databases when violating unique constraints.

Title: LazyInitializationException
Cause: Attempting to access an uninitialized proxy entity
How to Fix: Fetch required entities eagerly or in a transaction
Example Before: Accessing a @ManyToOne entity after session is closed
Example After: Use @Transactional or eager fetch strategy
Notes: Happens frequently in Hibernate due to lazy loading outside transaction scope.

Title: LineUnavailableException
Cause: Audio line could not be opened or accessed.
How to Fix: Ensure proper configuration of audio systems and drivers.
Example After: Validate that audio hardware and drivers support requested operations.
Notes: Occurs during playback or audio stream manipulation.

Title: llegalComponentStateException
Cause: Attempting to modify a GUI component in an invalid state.
How to Fix: Ensure the component is properly initialized and in a valid state.
Example After: if(button != null) button.setText("Submit");
Notes: Common in Swing and AWT GUI applications.

Title: LocaleError
Cause: Using an unsupported or invalid locale
How to Fix: Validate locales and encoding before setting them
Example Before: Setting locale as xy-XY when it's not supported
Example After: Use a valid locale like en-US
Notes: Happens when dealing with internationalization or encoding-related settings.

Title: MalformedURLException
Cause: Invalid URL format.
How to Fix: Verify URL syntax before operations.
Example After: try { new URL("https://valid.com"); } catch (MalformedURLException e) {}
Notes: Raised during URL parsing operations.

Title: MarshalException
Cause: Errors while marshalling objects for communication.
How to Fix: Ensure objects are compatible and properly formatted for serialization.
Example After: Use serializable objects and compatible formats.
Notes: Common in object serialization during remote calls.

Title: MediaException
Cause: Errors while handling multimedia data or processing streams.
How to Fix: Debug multimedia formats and ensure compatible codecs.
Example After: Validate multimedia formats before playback.
Notes: Common in media-based Java applications.

Title: Memory Leak
Cause: Resources not released after use
How to Fix: Explicitly close resources (e.g., files, streams)
Example After: Use finally block to ensure resource closure
Notes: Can lead to performance degradation in long-running applications.

Title: MemoryError
Cause: Using excessive memory beyond available system capacity
How to Fix: Optimize memory usage or increase system memory
Example Before: Loading a massive file into memory
Example After: Use chunk-based file processing to avoid memory overload
Notes: Occurs during operations with large data sets in limited environments.

Title: MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException
Cause: Incorrect type passed to URL parameters
How to Fix: Pass values that match expected parameter types
Example Before: Passing /user/abc when endpoint expects /user/{id} as integer
Example After: Pass /user/123
Notes: Happens due to parameter type mismatches in RESTful URLs.

Title: MissingAnnotationException
Cause: Required annotations not present in the code
How to Fix: Add the missing annotations
Example After: Annotate the class with @Service
Notes: Common in Spring Boot when key annotations like @Service, @Controller are omitted.

Title: MissingFormatArgumentException
Cause: Missing required arguments for format strings.
How to Fix: Ensure all format specifiers are matched with proper arguments.
Example After: Provide all arguments matching format specifiers.
Notes: Raised during dynamic string manipulation.

Title: MissingRequiredAnnotationError
Cause: Missing key annotations for proper functionality
How to Fix: Add the required annotation
Example After: Annotate the service with @Component
Notes: Happens when Spring Boot fails to register beans due to missing annotations.

Title: MissingResourceException
Cause: Resource bundle or key could not be found.
How to Fix: Ensure the required resources are present.
Example After: Check and validate the availability of resource files.
Notes: Common in internationalization or multi-language support.

Title: MissingServletRequestParameterException
Cause: Missing required parameters in the request
How to Fix: Provide all required parameters in the request
Example After: Send request with all required parameters: /user?id=123
Notes: Occurs when parameters annotated with @RequestParam are omitted in requests.

Title: MissingTransactionalAnnotationError
Cause: Failing to annotate methods requiring transactions
How to Fix: Add @Transactional annotation to appropriate methods
Example After: Annotate the method with @Transactional
Notes: Common when operations requiring transactions fail due to missing annotations.

Title: ModuleNotFoundError
Cause: Importing unavailable or non-installed modules
How to Fix: Install missing modules using pip
Example After: pip install valid_module
Notes: Occurs when trying to import modules not installed in the Python environment.

Title: NameError
Cause: Referencing variables before declaration or definition
How to Fix: Declare variables before usage
Example After: x = 10; print(x)
Notes: Occurs during usage of undefined variables in Python scripts.

Title: NegativeArraySizeException
Cause: Attempting to create an array with a negative size.
How to Fix: Validate array size before creation.
Example After: if(size >= 0) int[] arr = new int[size];
Notes: Critical when working with dynamic array sizing.

Title: NoHandlerFoundException
Cause: Accessing non-existent endpoint
How to Fix: Verify URL paths in requests
Example After: Send request to the correct endpoint, e.g., /valid-endpoint
Notes: Occurs due to incorrect routing or misconfigured endpoint mappings.

Title: NoninvertibleTransformException
Cause: Attempting to invert a non-invertible transform.
How to Fix: Ensure that transform matrices are invertible.
Example After: Validate and use proper mathematical transformations.
Notes: Common in graphics transformations or rendering.

Title: NoProviderForDirective
Cause: Missing provider for directives in module or component
How to Fix: Register providers for all used directives
Example Before: Not providing a service used in a component
Example After: Add the service in providers array in app.module.ts
Notes: Occurs when Angular cannot resolve services or directives dependencies.

Title: NoSuchAlgorithmException
Cause: Referencing an unsupported cryptographic algorithm
How to Fix: Use a valid and supported algorithm
Example Before: Attempting to use an invalid cipher algorithm
Example After: Use Cipher.getInstance("AES")
Notes: Happens when referencing unavailable cryptographic algorithms.

Title: NoSuchBeanDefinitionException
Cause: Bean definitions missing in Spring Boot configuration
How to Fix: Define the required beans in the configuration
Example After: Add @Bean in configuration class
Notes: Happens when Spring cannot find a required bean definition.

Title: NoSuchFieldError
Cause: Referencing a missing field in a class.
How to Fix: Validate field availability before operations.
Example After: Compile code with matching runtime classes and dependencies.
Notes: Raised when field mismatches occur.

Title: NoSuchMethodError
Cause: Invoking a method that is not present in the class definition at runtime.
How to Fix: Recompile dependent classes to resolve linking errors.
Example After: Ensure all required methods are properly defined and compiled.
Notes: Common during version mismatches in libraries.

Title: NoSuchProviderException
Cause: Requested security provider is not available in the environment.
How to Fix: Add the required security provider to the environment.
Example After: Ensure the provider is correctly configured and installed.
Notes: Common in environments missing cryptographic providers.

Title: NotActiveException
Cause: Calling methods on objects that are not currently active.
How to Fix: Ensure object activation before performing operations.
Example After: Activate objects as part of the proper lifecycle before invoking methods.
Notes: Common in object serialization frameworks.

Title: NoUniqueBeanDefinitionException
Cause: Multiple beans of the same type exist without qualifiers
How to Fix: Use @Qualifier or adjust bean definitions
Example Before: Autowiring without qualifiers when multiple beans exist
Example After: Use @Qualifier("specificBean") annotation
Notes: Common when Spring Boot fails to resolve dependencies due to ambiguity.

Title: NullInjectorError
Cause: Dependency injection issues in Angular components
How to Fix: Verify providers are correctly registered
Example After: Add correct providers in app.module.ts
Notes: Occurs when Angular cannot resolve dependencies in components/services.

Title: NullPointerException
Cause: Dereferencing null references or objects.
How to Fix: Validate and initialize objects before use.
Example After: if(str != null) str.length();
Notes: Most frequent exception in Java.

Title: NumberFormatException
Cause: Parsing non-numeric input into numeric types.
How to Fix: Validate input strings before parsing operations.
Example After: if(isNumeric(input)) Integer.parseInt(input);
Notes: Frequently occurs in applications requiring number parsing.

Title: OptimisticLockException
Cause: Concurrent updates to the same entity
How to Fix: Handle concurrency with versioning
Example Before: Two transactions updating the same row simultaneously
Example After: Use @Version annotation to manage concurrency
Notes: Happens in JPA when conflicting updates occur during transaction processing.

Title: OptimisticLockingFailureException
Cause: Concurrent modification of the same entity version
How to Fix: Use @Version annotation for entity versioning
Example Before: Two users updating the same row concurrently
Example After: Add @Version to entity and handle exceptions
Notes: Helps to prevent stale updates in concurrent transactions.

Title: OutOfMemoryError
Cause: JVM has exhausted all allocated heap space.
How to Fix: Optimize heap usage or increase JVM heap limits.
Example After: Ensure memory-intensive operations are properly managed.
Notes: Raised during high-memory allocations.

Title: OutOfMemoryError: Direct Buffer Memory
Cause: Direct memory buffer allocation exceeded limits.
How to Fix: Optimize memory usage or increase direct memory allocation.
Example After: Limit the size of allocated buffers to fit system constraints.
Notes: Common in NIO operations.

Title: OutOfMemoryError: GC Overhead Limit
Cause: Garbage collector runs excessively without freeing memory.
How to Fix: Optimize memory usage or increase heap size.
Example After: Use memory-efficient data structures and algorithms.
Notes: Common in applications with poor memory management.

Title: OutOfRangeError
Cause: Accessing values outside the allowed range
How to Fix: Ensure indices or ranges are within valid bounds
Example Before: my_list[-10] for a list with only 5 elements
Example After: Use if index >= 0 to validate before access
Notes: Happens when iterating or slicing beyond list or range limits.

Title: OverloadedUIError
Cause: Loading too much data or rendering too many elements
How to Fix: Optimize data loading and rendering strategies
Example Before: Loading 10,000 rows directly in the UI
Example After: Use pagination or virtual scrolling
Notes: Impacts application performance in frontend-heavy applications.

Title: PrimaryBeanMissingError
Cause: Missing primary bean for autowiring in multi-bean setup
How to Fix: Annotate one bean with @Primary or use qualifiers
Example After: Use @Primary for one of the beans
Notes: Common in configurations with multiple beans of the same type.

Title: PrimaryKeyViolationError
Cause: Duplicate values in a primary key column
How to Fix: Validate primary key values before insertion
Example After: Ensure unique primary key values
Notes: Occurs when duplicate primary keys are inserted into a table.

Title: PrinterAbortException
Cause: Printing job was aborted before completion.
How to Fix: Debug the printer service and ensure job integrity.
Example After: Avoid manual interruptions and verify print settings.
Notes: Common in GUI apps with print capabilities.

Title: PrinterException
Cause: Errors with printing services or print jobs.
How to Fix: Ensure printer services and jobs are configured correctly.
Example After: Debug the printer service or configurations causing failure.
Notes: Common in desktop or GUI-based apps with print functionality.

Title: PropertyAccessException
Cause: Accessing properties of an entity that are inaccessible
How to Fix: Ensure proper field mapping and access modifiers
Example Before: Using private fields without getters in an entity class
Example After: Add getters/setters or use appropriate access levels
Notes: Often caused by issues in Hibernate entity mapping.

Title: PropertyVetoException
Cause: Property change vetoed by a listener during bean operations.
How to Fix: Ensure property values and changes are supported.
Example After: Debug listener veto conditions for invalid property changes.
Notes: Raised in applications using Java Beans.

Title: ProviderException
Cause: Errors or issues with a security provider implementation.
How to Fix: Validate the security provider configuration and ensure compatibility.
Example After: Use trusted and properly implemented providers.
Notes: Raised in cryptographic operations with faulty providers.

Title: ProviderNotFoundError
Cause: Missing provider for dependency injection in Angular
How to Fix: Register providers in the app.module.ts
Example After: Add the missing provider in app.module.ts
Notes: Occurs when Angular cannot resolve providers for dependency injection.

Title: ProxyTargetClassError
Cause: Misconfigured proxy target class in bean creation
How to Fix: Use @EnableAspectJAutoProxy(proxyTargetClass=true)
Example After: Enable proxy target in configuration
Notes: Occurs during AOP proxy creation when proxy target class is not defined.

Title: QualifierMismatchError
Cause: Incorrect or missing @Qualifier in multi-bean setups
How to Fix: Add the correct @Qualifier annotation
Example Before: Multiple beans of the same type without qualifiers
Example After: Annotate dependencies with @Qualifier
Notes: Common when injecting beans in configurations with multiple bean options.

Title: QueryTimeoutError
Cause: Query execution taking too long
How to Fix: Optimize query logic or increase timeout
Example After: Improve indexing or set higher timeout limits
Notes: Happens when queries are slow due to unoptimized database operations.

Title: RecursionError
Cause: Exceeding the maximum recursion depth
How to Fix: Refactor recursive functions to include base cases
Example Before: Infinite recursion in a function call
Example After: Add a base case to end recursion
Notes: Occurs in Python when recursion depth exceeds the system-defined maximum limit.

Title: RemoteException
Cause: Communication failure during remote method invocation.
How to Fix: Validate RMI connections and server settings.
Example After: try { remote.method(); } catch (RemoteException e) {}
Notes: Common in distributed systems.

Title: Renderer Error
Cause: Using invalid properties in template binding
How to Fix: Review and fix binding to match component fields
Example After: Correctly bind {{validProperty}}
Notes: Happens during template rendering when bound fields do not exist in components.

Title: ResourceLeakError
Cause: Resources like files, sockets, or streams not properly closed
How to Fix: Always close resources in finally blocks
Example Before: Opening a file without closing it
Example After: Use try-with-resources or finally to close
Notes: Common in languages with explicit resource management (e.g., Java, C++).

Title: RowSetWarning
Cause: Warnings related to RowSet objects during data manipulation.
How to Fix: Address underlying issues causing warnings.
Example After: Handle and log RowSet warnings gracefully.
Notes: Non-fatal warnings during database operations.

Title: SAXException
Cause: Errors while processing or parsing XML data.
How to Fix: Validate XML format and structure.
Example After: Use well-formed XML data and ensure schemas are valid.
Notes: Common in XML parsing operations.

Title: ScopeAnnotationConflictError
Cause: Using conflicting scope annotations for the same bean
How to Fix: Define a consistent scope annotation
Example After: Define consistent scopes in bean configuration
Notes: Common when beans have multiple and conflicting lifecycle annotations.

Title: SecurityException
Cause: Trying to access restricted system resources or violating security policies.
How to Fix: Ensure correct permissions and validate security policies.
Example After: try { System.setSecurityManager(new SecurityManager()); } catch (SecurityException e) {}
Notes: Common in secure environments or restricted operations.

Title: SerializationError
Cause: Issues during object serialization or deserialization
How to Fix: Ensure that objects implement proper serialization protocols
Example Before: Saving an object without implementing Serializable
Example After: Implement Serializable or equivalent interfaces
Notes: Happens when saving or transferring objects across systems.

Title: ServiceConfigurationError
Cause: Issues in locating or loading service provider configurations.
How to Fix: Ensure service configurations and providers are properly set.
Example After: Validate service configuration files and providers.
Notes: Occurs when using ServiceLoader in modular applications.

Title: SocketException
Cause: Errors in socket operations.
How to Fix: Validate socket settings and usage.
Example After: try { socket.getOutputStream(); } catch (SocketException e) {}
Notes: Raised during socket-based communication.

Title: SQL Syntax Error
Cause: Writing incorrect queries
How to Fix: Check SQL syntax, validate query
Example After: SELECT * FROM table
Notes: Occurs due to missing keywords or clauses.

Title: SQLException
Cause: Issues with SQL syntax or database connections.
How to Fix: Validate database settings and query syntax.
Example After: try { stmt.executeQuery("VALID SQL"); } catch (SQLException e) {}
Notes: Common during database operations.

Title: SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException
Cause: Violation of database constraints such as unique, foreign key, etc.
How to Fix: Ensure data integrity and query compliance with constraints.
Example After: Validate query inputs and comply with database constraints.
Notes: Frequently occurs during database operations.

Title: SSLHandshakeException
Cause: SSL/TLS handshake failure due to invalid certificates or protocols.
How to Fix: Validate SSL certificates and protocols.
Example After: Use properly signed certificates and supported protocols.
Notes: Common in secure server communications.

Title: StackOverflowError
Cause: Infinite recursion or deeply nested method calls
How to Fix: Ensure a proper base case in recursive methods
Example After: Add base case: if(condition) return;
Notes: Happens when method calls exceed stack size limit.

Title: StopIteration
Cause: Exhausting an iterator before completing iteration
How to Fix: Handle iteration completion with try-except
Example After: Use for loop or check iterator status
Notes: Raised when calling next() on an empty iterator.

Title: StreamCorruptedException
Cause: Streams have been corrupted during data transmission.
How to Fix: Validate the stream and retry reading operations.
Example After: Use proper error handling for stream recovery.
Notes: Frequently raised in serialization-based communication.

Title: StringCodingError
Cause: Errors during JVM internal string encoding or decoding.
How to Fix: Debug encoding libraries and check for valid string inputs.
Example After: Use supported encoding schemes and valid strings.
Notes: Occurs in internationalization-heavy applications.

Title: SyncFailedException
Cause: Failure in syncing file data to the underlying storage.
How to Fix: Ensure sufficient disk space and valid file system permissions.
Example After: Handle disk-related exceptions gracefully.
Notes: Occurs during low-level file operations.

Title: SyntaxError
Cause: Writing invalid Python code
How to Fix: Correct syntax mistakes and validate code
Example After: Add colon: if x > 0:
Notes: Occurs when Python syntax rules are violated.

Title: SyntaxErrorException
Cause: Writing malformed or invalid SQL syntax
How to Fix: Correct the syntax and verify the query format
Example After: SELECT * FROM table
Notes: Syntax errors occur when the query structure is incorrect.

Title: Template Parse Error
Cause: Incorrect HTML template syntax or bindings
How to Fix: Fix HTML template and ensure valid bindings
Example After: {{variable}}
Notes: Happens due to missing braces or invalid bindings in Angular templates.

Title: TemplateBindingError
Cause: Binding to a property that doesn’t exist in the component
How to Fix: Verify property existence before binding
Example After: Ensure nonExistentProperty exists in the component class
Notes: Common during property binding with misspelled or missing properties.

Title: TemplateNotFoundError
Cause: Missing or misnamed templates in components
How to Fix: Verify template file paths
Example After: Add correct templateUrl in component
Notes: Common when Angular cannot locate specified template files.

Title: TemplateSyntaxError
Cause: Using incorrect syntax in Angular templates
How to Fix: Verify correct template syntax
Example After: Correctly bind templates like [attr.prop]
Notes: Happens frequently during binding or structural directives in Angular.

Title: ThreadDeath
Cause: A thread was forcefully stopped with Thread.stop().
How to Fix: Use graceful thread interruption instead of stop().
Example After: Replace stop() with interruption-based lifecycle management.
Notes: Raised when deprecated lifecycle methods are used.

Title: TransactionDeadlock
Cause: Multiple processes causing deadlock on shared resources
How to Fix: Use proper transaction isolation or lock escalation
Example Before: Concurrent processes updating the same records
Example After: Rearrange transaction sequence
Notes: Happens in concurrent database operations with poor locking mechanisms.

Title: TransactionRequiredException
Cause: Executing operations on entities outside transactions
How to Fix: Use @Transactional annotation
Example After: Wrap operations in @Transactional method
Notes: Occurs frequently in JPA while performing entity operations without transactions.

Title: TransactionRolledBackException
Cause: Improper transaction handling or failure during execution
How to Fix: Review and correct transaction boundaries
Example After: Handle rollback explicitly using @Transactional annotation
Notes: Occurs when transactions fail and no proper rollback is configured.

Title: TransformerException
Cause: Issues while transforming XML documents using XSLT.
How to Fix: Ensure XSLT and XML documents are compatible.
Example After: Debug transformer configurations and document formats.
Notes: Raised in XML transformation pipelines.

Title: TypeError
Cause: Performing operations on incompatible types
How to Fix: Convert or match data types
Example After: 'a' + str(1)
Notes: Occurs often with string and numeric operations.

Title: TypeMismatchDataAccessException
Cause: Mismatched types between query parameters and database fields
How to Fix: Use compatible data types and validate query params
Example Before: Using String for a numeric database field
Example After: Use the correct data type: Integer
Notes: Occurs in Spring Boot repositories and query execution with incorrect types.

Title: TypeNotPresentException
Cause: Indicates that a referenced class or type is not available.
How to Fix: Verify classpath and ensure all required classes are included.
Example After: Correct type references or class loading configurations.
Notes: Common during runtime reflection-based operations.

Title: UncaughtException
Cause: An exception was thrown in a thread but not caught.
How to Fix: Add a default uncaught exception handler.
Example After: Use Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler() for managing errors.
Notes: Raised in multi-threaded applications.

Title: UnhandledPromiseRejection
Cause: Promises not properly handled with .catch()
How to Fix: Always handle errors in promises using .catch()
Example After: promise.then(() => doSomething()).catch(err => console.log(err));
Notes: Common when using asynchronous JavaScript code with promises.

Title: UniqueConstraintViolation
Cause: Inserting duplicate values into unique columns
How to Fix: Ensure input values are unique
Example After: Validate uniqueness before insertion
Notes: Occurs when attempting to insert duplicate primary key values.

Title: UnknownHostException
Cause: Hostname cannot be resolved.
How to Fix: Verify hostname and DNS settings.
Example After: try { InetAddress.getByName("valid.com"); } catch (UnknownHostException e) {}
Notes: Common during socket programming.

Title: UnmarshalException
Cause: Errors in unmarshalling data during RMI operations.
How to Fix: Ensure data consistency between serialization and deserialization formats.
Example After: Verify object formats and configurations before operations.
Notes: Raised during remote method invocations.

Title: UnmodifiableClassException
Cause: Attempting to redefine or modify a class that cannot be altered.
How to Fix: Ensure the class is modifiable before using redefinition APIs.
Example After: Verify class properties and avoid attempts to redefine immutable classes.
Notes: Raised in advanced instrumentation scenarios.

Title: UnreachableCodeError
Cause: Writing code that will never be executed
How to Fix: Remove or refactor unreachable code
Example Before: Code after a return or break statement
Example After: Ensure logical flow of the program
Notes: Happens when unreachable blocks of code exist in any logic flow.

Title: UnresolvedLinkError
Cause: Unresolved method or field reference during class linking.
How to Fix: Debug linkage between dependencies and ensure correct configurations.
Example After: Validate runtime library versions and patch missing dependencies.
Notes: Common in modular or dependency-heavy applications.

Title: UnsatisfiedDependencyError
Cause: Missing required dependencies for a bean
How to Fix: Verify dependency configurations and inject all required beans
Example After: Add missing dependency through @Autowired or @Bean
Notes: Common when Spring Boot fails to resolve bean dependencies.

Title: UnsatisfiedDependencyException
Cause: Missing required dependencies in the application context
How to Fix: Add the necessary beans/dependencies
Example After: Add service configuration or @ComponentScan
Notes: Occurs when Spring Boot cannot resolve dependencies due to misconfiguration.

Title: UnsupportedCharsetException
Cause: Using an unsupported character set for encoding.
How to Fix: Use supported charsets; validate configurations.
Example After: try { Charset.forName("UTF-8"); } catch (UnsupportedCharsetException e) {}
Notes: Occurs during text encoding or decoding.

Title: UnsupportedFlavorException
Cause: Unsupported data format in clipboard operations.
How to Fix: Verify clipboard data format compatibility.
Example After: Use supported clipboard data formats for operations.
Notes: Common in drag-and-drop or clipboard-based functionality.

Title: UnsupportedOperationError
Cause: Using a feature or method not supported by the platform
How to Fix: Check platform documentation for compatibility
Example Before: Calling delete in languages without garbage collection
Example After: Use valid features supported by the platform
Notes: Common when porting code across incompatible platforms.

Title: UnsupportedOperationException
Cause: Performing operations unsupported by the collection
How to Fix: Use collection-specific methods for safe operations
Example After: Use mutable lists like new ArrayList<>()
Notes: Occurs when modifying immutable collections in Java.

Title: ValueError
Cause: Passing invalid arguments to functions
How to Fix: Validate input values before function calls
Example After: Use if value.isdigit() before casting
Notes: Occurs when arguments mismatch expected formats (e.g., casting issues).

Title: VerifyError
Cause: JVM detected invalid bytecode during class loading.
How to Fix: Debug class file generation and ensure valid bytecode.
Example After: Ensure bytecode complies with JVM specifications.
Notes: Raised during class file verification.

Title: XPathExpressionException
Cause: Invalid XPath expressions while querying XML documents.
How to Fix: Validate XPath expressions before execution.
Example After: Use properly formatted XPath expressions.
Notes: Occurs during advanced XML queries.
